entry.title: [FaceGaze] Unhook mouse position and landmark update rates
entry.content:
Separating the mouse updates from the frame rate will allow the UI

to feel a bit more snappy even when the frames are lagging.



This supports a possible future in which face landmark updates

come from a face landmark extension API rather than from within the

same facegaze extension.



Also, this change resolves a simple TODO to respect details of

screen bounds (top and left).



Bug: b/317235785

AX-Relnotes: N/A

Test: New, existing, manual

Change-Id: Ie33f2f08fc5fbe4c983b2948629fe0e5972a7514

entry.title: HDR/macOS: Allow F16 overlays
entry.content:
The format gfx::BufferFormat::RGBA_F16 is always supported on macOS.

Ensure that this is enabled in feature flags. This was causing any HDR

content on a page to send the full window to drop out of overlay mode.



In metal::HDRCopierLayer, change the native PQ conversion to set SDR

white to 203 nits instead of 100. This functionality is still

experimental and behind a flag.

entry.title: [TLDD] Restore tab container when drop does not re-parent
entry.content:
Restore tab container when drop does not re-parent.

-Could occur as a result of an invalid drop or the drop being treated as

a link drop (e.g. in omnibox or another app).

-Reuse the tab creation animation (width expand & translate up).

-Done on drag end if tab still exists in the source strip (i.e. it was

not re-parented).

entry.title: Record more item count histograms for holding space.
entry.content:
Existing item count histograms cannot answer questions about how many

items of a given type are backed by files in a given file system. To

answer these questions, this CL adds the following histograms:



* HoldingSpace.Item.TotalCountV2.All.FileSystemType.{fs_type}

* HoldingSpace.Item.TotalCountV2.{type}.FileSystemType.{fs_type}

* HoldingSpace.Item.VisibleCount.All.FileSystemType.{fs_type}

* HoldingSpace.Item.VisibleCount.{type}.FileSystemType.{fs_type}



Note that for now analysts only care about the Drive and local file

systems, so those file systems are allowlisted to limit the number of

histograms recorded arising from combinations with holding space item

type. The solution is scalable such that other file systems can easily

be added if the need arises.



This CL also fixes the max bucket of file extension related histograms

entry.title: Rename some functions for clarity.
entry.content:
Changing `onSpeechStopped` to `onSpeechFinished`. The callback isn't

(necessarily) used when speech is paused, but is called when speech is

finished.



Changing `playCurrentMessage` to `playTextOf(axNodeIds)`. I think it's

less confusing given that the function is called from `playNextMessage`,

`playPreviousMessage`, etc.



No functionality changes, just a minor refactor.

entry.title: [A11y] Require immediate processing for semantics changes
entry.content:
Changing these reduces flakes for event tests that require specific

batches of events to occur for semantics changes, while being unlikely

to have real world performance consequences. Specifically helps

deflake to enable landing the performance improvement CL:5132040.



Returning false allows us to not serialize immediately, and wait

~150ms or for the next user input event before serializing, which

can affect event order.

entry.title: [MagicStack] Page indicator works on tablets to show 2 items per screen.
entry.content:
In this CL, we change the recyclerview work in two stages:

1) When showing a single item per screen, it supports snap scroll and

page transition animation on the page indicator.

2) when showing more than 1 item per screen, it doesn't support snap

scroll which always places the targeted view in the centre of the

screen, rather than align to the left. Besides, only highlighted dot

is drawn but there isn't any transition animation for the page

indicator.

Also support auto adjustment for items per screen based on the screen

width.

Demo for tablets: https://drive.google.com/file/d/17se6VrgDKefMZZvVasSqCK9S-mZrFamY/view?usp=drive_link

Demo for phones:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1JlVZDtKY_96gP7ctadT93Bn5QI6r8i1X/view?usp=drive_link

entry.title: Call ClientWait on GLFences for back pressure.
entry.content:
Sleeping in loops has a tendency to wait longer than necessary because

the system has no indication of what's being waited for and when the

system is under heavy load, sleep block for much longer than requested.



The previous bugs with calling client wait for fences were on MacOS

versions that are no longer supported by Chrome (10.9).

entry.title: Revisit some kEnablePasswordsAccountStorage flag checks in tests
entry.content:
An upcoming CL will convert such flag checks into calls to a new

predicate UseSplitStores(PrefService*) (name TBD). This CL removes as

many existing checks as possible, so the next change is smaller and

easier to understand. In particular, some tests were doing:

```

void SetUp() {

// Checks the default value of the flag in the platform where the

// test is run.

if (base::FeatureList::IsEnabled(kEnablePasswordsAccountStorage) {

// Do some account storage setup.

}

}

```



Notice how this would become weird with a PrefService dependency.

```

// What am I checking? Whether I myself overrode the relevant pref

// value?

if (UseSplitStores(testing_pref_service) {

}

```



Instead, run tests for both the enabled and disabled codepaths on

every platform, using a parameterized test.

```

// The boolean parameter indicates whether to set up an account

store.

if (GetParam()) {

}

```



Bug: 1509058

scheduling behavior with respect to AssociatedInterfaces.

entry.title: [X11] Avoid round trips to obtain pointer position
entry.content:
On Wayland, there's no way to obtain the cursor position, so

WaylandScreenOzone instead keeps track of the most recently seen

cursor position from events. This CL adds similar behavior to

X11ScreenOzone to prevent round-tripping to obtain the cursor

position.

entry.content:

Reason for revert:

LUCI Bisection has identified this change as the culprit of a build failure. See the analysis: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/bisection/compile-analysis/b/8758444642896278033



Sample failed build: https://ci.chromium.org/b/8758444642896278033



If this is a false positive, please report it at https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/entry?comment=Analysis%3A+https%3A%2F%2Fci.chromium.org%2Fui%2Fp%2Fchromium%2Fbisection%2Fcompile-analysis%2Fb%2F8758444642896278033&components=Tools%3ETest%3EFindit&labels=LUCI-Bisection-Wrong%2CPri-3%2CType-Bug&status=Available&summary=Wrongly+blamed+https%3A%2F%2Fchromium-review.googlesource.com%2Fc%2Fchromium%2Fsrc%2F%2B%2F5214683



Original change's description:

> Add a new variant of ScriptPromiseResolve Resolve/Reject

>

> These variants require the caller to provide an explicit IDL type with

> which to resolve or reject the promise. This allows us to use

> ToV8Traits to do the conversion, and more precisely handle things like

> nullability.

>

> This logic is unused, but callers will be converted to use it in

> upcoming patches.

entry.content:
This reverts commit 33b78adc0eea3ea670d12480aa353defa6123d63.



Reason for reland: Fixed wrong value for AAUDIO_MIN_API



Original change's description:

> Revert "Android: Enable __ANDROID_UNAVAILABLE_SYMBOLS_ARE_WEAK__"

>

> This reverts commit 7a58fcee02ffb8fe83cfa1a67a7cb445c26f2f01.

> https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/bisection/test-analysis/b/5646442452484096

>

> Original change's description:

> > Android: Enable __ANDROID_UNAVAILABLE_SYMBOLS_ARE_WEAK__

> >

> > This simplifies calling functions that are introduced after our

> > minSdkVersion.

> >

> > Adds two macros to make availability attributes less verbose:

> > class REQUIRES_ANDROID_API(x)

> > is short for:

> > class __attribute__((__availability__(android, introduced = x)))

> >

> > #pragma clang attribute push DEFAULT_REQUIRES_ANDROID_API(29)

> > is short for:

> > #pragma clang attribute push(__attribute__((__availability__(android, introduced = x))), apply_to = any(enum, enum_constant, field, function, namespace, record, type_alias, variable))

> >

> > The new warnings (from -Wunguarded-availability) triggered in only two

> > spots: aaudio_stream_wrapper.cc, and ndk_media_codec_wrapper.cc

> >

> > This commit converts these two files from explicit dlopen() / dlsym()

> > to using weak symbols and availability attributes.

> >

> > See: https://android.googlesource.com/platform/ndk/+/master/docs/BuildSystemMaintainers.md#weak-symbols-for-api-definitions

> >

entry.title: Detach children ownership from AddressComponent nodes.
entry.content:
The goal of the CL is to detach AddressComponent child ownership from

the parent. Each node will now keep only pointers to their children.

Ownership of all the address nodes in the hierarchy has been moved to

the Address class.



This CL is the first step to introducing synthesized nodes, which

will require to list as children its constituents, but can not

own them.

entry.title: [Hub] Fix a number of asserts/crashes/frozen UI situations
entry.content:
When using the "Move tab to other window" feature while the Hub tab

switcher was visible the HubLayout#startHiding() call would happen

multiple times in a row. 1) for the move tabs intent, 2) for the new

tab being added, 3) for selecting the moved tab.



This led to a combination of race conditions and unserviced callbacks

that resulting in the Hub becoming stuck in the "isStartingToHide"

state and never reaching doneHiding() so the UI would never go away.



The fix for this is to

1) Ensure forceAnimationToFinish always executes the supplied

animation.

2) Guard against supplying animation data late for ShrinkExpand.

3) Prevent tab creation while hiding from triggering another hide.



Bug: b/321005166

Change-Id: I5e575f9002e587c085799cfb6dc475fb75610376

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5217415

entry.title: ash: fix flaky OverviewSessionTest.Basic test
entry.content:
Some animation smoothness metric calculations don't work well with tests

in that not enough compositor frames are necessarily drawn, resulting in

callbacks returning early. In this case, the histogram callback is

skipped, resulting in missing histograms.



This CL updates the flaky test to use a slightly slower animation

duration, as well as waiting until enough compositor frames are drawn

before attempting to check the histograms.



Bug: b/309661233

Test: updated existing test

entry.title: Use the system updater in cross-user update configurations.
entry.content:
This will cause the "Chrome cannot keep itself up to date" banner to

show in more circumstances on multi-user macOS devices. However, the

appropriate thing on such devices is to attempt to upgrade Chrome to be

managed by a system updater. Multiple user updaters lead to accumulation

of versioned framework directories and other problems; refer to the bug

for details.



Also, refactored GetBundleOwned* a bit to prevent double-stat'ing in the

new code.

entry.title: Revert "Check NativeThemeFluent doesn't have css colors when HC is on."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 0c0c0b555c3ad229c73db212216d3bdbdd2c61d4.



Reason for revert:

The change causes renderer crashes due to CHECKs when the HC mode on Windows as enabled. The investigation and the implementation of necessary fixes are in progress.



Original change's description:

> Check NativeThemeFluent doesn't have css colors when HC is on.

>

> Painting functions in NativeThemeFluent depend on the correct input

> from its callers to get the colors for the scrollbars' parts. If

> CSS colors are enabled at the same time as forced colors, the function

> would override the forced colors in favor of the css ones.

>

> This CL adds CHECKS in the painting functions to make sure that this

> situation doesn't occur.

>

entry.title: [AsyncSB] Consolidate pre-commit and post-commit blocking page into one function
entry.content:
With async SB check, the function

SafeBrowsingUIManager::CreateBlockingPageForSubresource will no longer

be accurate because blocking page on the mainframe URL can also

be created from this code path. This CL simplifies the code by

combining the creation of pre-commit blocking page (from

SafeBrowsingNavigationThrottle::WillFailRequest) and post-commit

blocking page (from BaseUIManager::DisplayBlockingPage) into

one function.



Enterprise real-time check always delays main page load, so it is

impossible that a post-commit blocking page has

SB_THREAT_TYPE_MANAGED_POLICY_WARN or

SB_THREAT_TYPE_MANAGED_POLICY_BLOCK as its threat type. Therefore, this

CL doesn't have behavioral change.



Bug: 1501194

Change-Id: I6f6dc81cf0da2e3cc114b691e8a1822a2fbb374b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5202528

Reviewed-by: Nate Fischer

entry.title: Restore test by running it in a VTS
entry.content:
The requestAnimationFrame throttling test flakes as the number of rAFs

counted by the test is prolonged by placing the frame doing the counting

in a separate process than the frame making the decision about the

throttling.



This CL tries to avoid losing the test coverage by placing the affected

test into a virtual test suite (VTS) that disables the cross-process

behavior. The test will be exclusive to the VTS, and so the

TestExpectations entry can be removed.



Bug: 1515794, 510122

entry.title: Remove kWebAppEnableScopeExtensions feature flag check for origin flash
entry.content:
The removed flag cannot be enabled easily at runtime for origin trial.

Instead of checking the feature flag, check the presence of scope

extensions entries in the displayed web app to achieve a similar effect.



New behavior:

- When the feature is disabled, apps will show the static origin text.

(Same as before)

- When the feature is enabled but the app does not use scope_extensions,

show the static origin text. (Different)

- When the feature is enabled and app uses scope_extensions, show the

dynamic origin text.



(Static origin text -> origin text formatted from start URL.)

entry.title: [BreakoutBox] Do not require a sink signal to do eager conversion
entry.content:
MediaStreamVideoTrackUnderlyingSink tries to convert RGB frames to NV12

if it has observed a signal from sinks requesting GMB-backed frames.

In practice, this occurs when a WebRTC sink wants to use hardware

encoding.



We have observed that the signal usually arrives after some RGB frames

have been sent to the sink and it has fallen back to software encoding,

making the conversions useless.



This CL:

* Enables the conversion without waiting for the signal, similar to

how canvas capture does it.

* Adds a kill switch for enabling conversion without signal.

* Makes getting the GMB manager synchronous, even if running outside

the main thread.

* Rewrites the condition for eager format conversion so that it is

easier to read.



Bug: 1519558

Change-Id: Idc953d9569f2252615a3b9ea99a8f0171db0bf31

entry.title: [ios] Dont show suggestions with no username on single username form
entry.content:
Related to: go/bling-signin-uff-prd



This is to mitigate the cases where there is no username to be filled

in the single username form (as highlighted in the prd:

http://shortn/_s1WO18oJeO).



The logic here only applies to the username form in UFF. The

single password form is untouched.



Having suggestion with no option to fill a username feels broken and

isn't a great user experience.



Also, the keyboard accessory should fallback to Autofill suggestions

to at least suggest email addresses when there is no username

available in the stored credentials.



This means the check suggestions query should return false if the

only available credentials are empty usernames with no value.



No suggestions are returned if all the usernames are empty (it is

theoretically possible to only have one empty username but it is

good to handle multiple just in case).



If there is an empty username along other non-empty usernames, the

empty username is still part of the suggestions to keep the

suggestions consistent across the username and password forms in the

sign-in uff flow.



Implementation validation slides: http://shortn/_PCi5dD4PLR

> We've discussed details and decided to show empty usernames when

there are other available usernames in the suggestions.



Gated behind the kIOSPasswordSignInUff flag where it will be

co-launched with sign-in uff feature.



Bug: b/320291554

entry.title: Use PWM::FormDataParser predictions to perform similarity check.
entry.content:
This CL modifies the similarity check that is performed between the

cached form and the focused form when deciding whether to attempt

showing a bottomsheet.



The logic contained in this CL uses password_manager::FormDataParser

predictions to determine similarity: The two forms are similar iff

the fields predicted by FormDataParser as username and password fields

are identical.



For non-password forms this check would work poorly, but currently

prefill requests are sent exclusively for login forms.



The changes in the code are guarded behind a flag.



Bug: 1513847

entry.title: Revert "Reland^2 "android: Make arm64 builds HighEnd by default""
entry.content:
This reverts commit 7ce33d14425dd41749c33cf86602ef246185d657.



Reason for revert: More bot failures:

* chromium-internal-arm64-builder-rel

* chromium-internal-arm-builder-rel

* arm64-unpublished-builder-rel

* arm64-builder-rel



Original change's description:

> Reland^2 "android: Make arm64 builds HighEnd by default"

>

> This reverts commit df45839bc319c8101f8217255db75229b0f7d8cc.

>

> Reason for reland: android-binary-size-generator now has PGO profiles,

> and this change now updates static initializer logic.

>

> Original change's description:

> > android: Make arm64 builds HighEnd by default

> >

> > The most popular arm64 builds (Trichrome) are shipping with

> > is_high_end_android. The Monochrome arm64 builds are shipped for old

> > devices, and we expect these to gradually become less popular.

> >

> > This change sets is_high_end_android to true for arm64 builds by

> > default.

> >

> > This would make local benchmarking slightly less error prone because

> > there would be a little less to remember to set in GN args when making a

> > build for the most popular official configuration.

> >

> > Known effects:

> >

> > 1. Seemingly all official arm64 builders now explicitly set

> > is_high_end_android. Hence no effect for them.

> >

> > 2. Non-official arm64 builders will change to become high-end, even the

> > ones that end up running on old devices (example: android-arm64-rel).

> > In this patch we make sure that is_high_end_android is ignored for

> > non-official builds (disabled RELR relocations for non-official).

> > Hence, no effect here as well.

> >

> > 3. Official builds of Monochrome made by devs would fail to run on

> > Android pre-P (because RELR support is lacking). This leads to

> > mysterious crashes during something-dlopen in the Android dynamic

> > linker. Hopefully nobody does this before we remove support for

> > Android O.

> >

> > Bug: 1515925

> > Change-Id: I695c98852bb410894144452211aa06cc32ffb141

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5169071

entry.title: Avoid test timeouts from AXObjectCacheImpl::CheckTreeIsUpdated
entry.content:
When DCHECK is on, we verify the tree is correct after every update.

This verification is slow and work has been done to cap the number

of elements in large trees. Still, even with those caps, these checks

contributed to a timeout error of a test added here:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5147927



So this CL implements two other idea to continue the checks but with less overhead.

* The tree check is not run before the document is finished loading.

* The tree is now checked after the first 1-5 updates, and after that,

it is only checked, at most, every 5 seconds.



Change-Id: I8a4f2e5149d9a5d9d2e335a935675d309ce22272

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5193398

Reviewed-by: Aaron Leventhal

Reviewed-by: Joanmarie Diggs

Commit-Queue: Aaron Leventhal

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1249350}

entry.title: [FedCM] Allow setting login status from a same-site request
entry.content:
This relaxes the same-origin requirement to same-site for processing

the login status header. This is useful for IDPs who process IDP

logins on a different host than the FedCM endpoint.



This is behind a default-enabled flag so we can easily disable this

in case of issues.



The virtual test suite explicitly enables the flag so that the test

will keep working in case the flag has to be turned off.



Approved by Security & Privacy in

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1vZiEh4Q45gleW0lmtfgxMflqarMkcTk0Itwoo6724Vo/edit?resourcekey=0-WjqaM1SrhAoFbhmGNyyyJA&tab=t.0



Bug: 1516640

Change-Id: I8825e66b43d7d3a6fae7db2447281502fb8015c9

entry.title: Ash: Don't throttle XHR requests for non-Google properties
entry.content:
https://crrev.com/c/1434283 migrated a utility that throttled XHR

requests to Google web properties until ChromeOS (Ash) has minted

cookies for the user. This is useful for avoiding error messages that

tell the user that they are logged out - since users are supposed to

have an SSO experience in ChromeOS.



During this migration however, the implementation was slightly changed.

The original implementation -

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1434283/5/chrome/browser/chromeos/login/signin/merge_session_resource_throttle.cc#b59

used to check if the request being throttled is a request to a Google

sub-domain. The new implementation didn't check for this -

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1434283/5/chrome/renderer/chromeos_merge_session_loader_throttle.cc#45



Fix this by filtering requests to Google sub-domains when throttling.



Bug: b/315072145

Test: unit_tests --gtest_filter="*AshMergeSessionLoaderThrottleTest*"

Test: browser_tests --gtest_filter="*MergeSessionTimeoutTest*"

Change-Id: I6fe61a6830853eee5c817a5100efd243ff31612d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5201765

Reviewed-by: Ilya Sherman

Reviewed-by: Anastasiia N

Reviewed-by: David Roger

Commit-Queue: Kush Sinha

Reviewed-by: Xiyuan Xia

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1249346}

entry.title: Reland "Kcer: Split GetKeyInfo"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 02c439796393e29c28763c1272ca112cde4c6747

Fix: Updated kcer_nss_fuzzer.cc



Original change's description:

> Kcer: Split GetKeyInfo

>

> The original idea was to retrieve all the attributes at once

> because that can be done efficiently with the PKCS#11 interface.

> Unfortunately in cases when the size of attributes is not known and

> they can be missing, this doesn’t actually work well. E.g. if one

> attribute was never set and the provided buffer for another one is

> too small, the PKCS#11 interface can just return that some attributes

> are missing and then the caller has to retry with a different set

> of attributes to check that the “buffer is too small” error was

> not hidden by the “attribute is missing” one.

> So for custom attributes that are often never set it’s easier to

> retrieve them separately.

>

> Introduce GetKeyPermissions and GetCertProvisioningProfileId and

> refactor the existing code to implement them.

>

> Bug: b:287015636

> Test: *Kcer* unit tests

> Change-Id: I90f45890c49c75843fadcc487867f759db426818

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5176968

> Commit-Queue: Michael Ershov

> Reviewed-by: Pavol Marko

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1248086}



Bug: b:287015636

Change-Id: Ib02b659e148034669952915f7d8eca5b2efa04af

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5210336

Commit-Queue: Michael Ershov

Reviewed-by: Pavol Marko

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1249341}

entry.title: [iOS][TS] Clips subviews to bounds
entry.content:
This CL:

- Clips collection view subviews to bounds.

tail of the selected cell.

entry.title: Use PWM predictions in the form sent in the cache request.
entry.content:
Prior to this CL, the PasswordManager::FormDataParser predictions were

used to decide whether a form is a login form, but were not actually

applied to the form sent in the prefill request.



This CL changes that. Since this CL has an impact on the data sent

for prefill requests, it is guarded behind a feature flag. For that,

we use the feature flag for comparison by form signature id. We will

rename the feature to something along the lines of

"UsePasswordManagerParserPredictionsForPrefillRequests" in a follow-up

CL.



Bug: 1513847

entry.title: Simplify paint-order handling for SVG text and decorations
entry.content:
Add a constructor that "compress" the paint-order list by moving the

'markers' keyword to the last position. Markers are not painted for text

or decorations so will always be ignored, and this simplifies the

handling since only two actual sequences need to be considered.



For painting add one helper to resolve the paint order and one to

iterate the resolved list and dispatch to the relevant paint function.

entry.title: [ios] Use TestSessionRestorationService in GridMediatorTestClass
entry.content:
Some tests based on GridMediatorTestClass uses fake WebStates which

causes them to fail when using the SessionRestorationService version

based on the new optimised session storage (as the fake WebStates do

not implement correctly SerializeToProto).



Since those tests don't depend on serialisation, install a test

implementation of SessionRestorationService to make the independent

of the service.

entry.title: [iOS] Rename DownloadManager{TabHelper,Coordinator} methods
entry.content:
This CL renames some methods in the download manager code, as these

methods will do different things because of UI changes in Save to Drive.

As a result of these changes, the account picker presented by Save to

Drive will also let the user select "Files" as a destination for their

download, which is why some "regular" downloads need to be started from

the DownloadManagerTabHelper. As a result

- `OnDownloadAddedToSaveToDrive()` is renamed to `StartDownload()` and

- `Download()` is renamed to `SetCurrentDownload()`, since this method

effectively changes what `DownloadTask` instance is currently active

in the current tab.



Bug: 1495353
